content.question: On average, after one year of operation, the potential of a lithium-iodine cell decreases by 1%-2%. Which of the following best helps to explain the cause for the decrease in cell potential?

choices.label: <math alttext="E naught sub cell equals E naught sub reduction of the cathode, minus E naught sub reduction of the anode" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>E</mi><msub><mrow><mi>°</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>c</mi><mi>e</mi><mi>l</mi><mi>l</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mi>E</mi><msub><mrow><mi>°</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>r</mi><mi>e</mi><mi>d</mi></mrow></msub><mtext>(</mtext><mtext>cathode)</mtext><mo>−</mo><mi>E</mi><msub><mrow><mi>°</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>r</mi><mi>e</mi><mi>d</mi></mrow></msub><mtext>(anode)</mtext></mrow></math>, and as the cell operates, <math alttext="E naught sub reduction of the cathode" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>E</mi><msub><mrow><mi>°</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>r</mi><mi>e</mi><mi>d</mi></mrow></msub><mtext>(cathode)</mtext></mrow></math> decreases.

<math alttext="E naught sub cell equals E naught sub reduction of the cathode, minus E naught sub reduction of the anode" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>E</mi><msub><mrow><mi>°</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>c</mi><mi>e</mi><mi>l</mi><mi>l</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mi>E</mi><msub><mrow><mi>°</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>r</mi><mi>e</mi><mi>d</mi></mrow></msub><mtext>(</mtext><mtext>cathode)</mtext><mo>−</mo><mi>E</mi><msub><mrow><mi>°</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>r</mi><mi>e</mi><mi>d</mi></mrow></msub><mtext>(anode)</mtext></mrow></math>, and as the cell operates, <math alttext="E naught sub reduction of the anode" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>E</mi><msub><mrow><mi>°</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>r</mi><mi>e</mi><mi>d</mi></mrow></msub><mtext>(anode)</mtext></mrow></math> increases.

<math alttext="E sub cell equals E naught sub cell minus the fraction R T over n F, end fraction, times the natural log of Q" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>E</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>c</mi><mi>e</mi><mi>l</mi><mi>l</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mi>E</mi><msub><mrow><mi>°</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>c</mi><mi>e</mi><mi>l</mi><mi>l</mi></mrow></msub><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>R</mi><mi>T</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi><mi>F</mi></mrow></mfrac><mi>ln</mi><mi>Q</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, and as the cell operates, <math alttext="Q" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>Q</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> decreases.

<math alttext="E sub cell equals E naught sub cell minus the fraction R T over n F, end fraction, times the natural log of Q" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>E</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>c</mi><mi>e</mi><mi>l</mi><mi>l</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mi>E</mi><msub><mrow><mi>°</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>c</mi><mi>e</mi><mi>l</mi><mi>l</mi></mrow></msub><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>R</mi><mi>T</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi><mi>F</mi></mrow></mfrac><mi>ln</mi><mi>Q</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, and as the cell operates, <math alttext="Q" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>Q</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> increases.

content.answer: <math alttext="E sub cell equals E naught sub cell minus the fraction R T over n F, end fraction, times the natural log of Q" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>E</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>c</mi><mi>e</mi><mi>l</mi><mi>l</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mi>E</mi><msub><mrow><mi>°</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>c</mi><mi>e</mi><mi>l</mi><mi>l</mi></mrow></msub><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>R</mi><mi>T</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi><mi>F</mi></mrow></mfrac><mi>ln</mi><mi>Q</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, and as the cell operates, <math alttext="Q" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>Q</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> increases.

skill.text: 6.D: Provide reasoning to justify a claim using chemical principles or laws, or using mathematical justification.
